comments.body: I don't love this approach to testing, but it also seemed like the natural place for the `nil` case to live.  I could break this out to its own `func` if you think that would read better, though.

I think a better way to verify this would be to change getToken to fail the test at this point, reissue the get request, and expect it to fail (verifying the cache usage rather than the implementation).
